full_text:
The International Fact-Checking Network (IFCN) at Poynter has been a champion for the best practices and exchanges of fact-based information since it was established in 2015. Today, the IFCN is a global leader in fact-checking excellence, providing more than 100 operations around the world with:

- Resources to adopt basic fact-checking standards including the IFCN's Code of Principles
- Grants and fellowships to help fact-checkers, solution providers and other eligible organizations launch new and innovative fact-checking programs and initiatives
- Online and in-person trainings to help fact-checkers develop critical skills, build capacity and contribute to public discourse
- Analyses of the field's latest developments in an annual State of the Fact-Checkers Report, articles and a weekly newsletter to identify and forecast industry trends, surface common positions of fact-checkers worldwide and monitor global policy-making about fact-checking

Opportunities to connect with fact-checkers from countries around the world at events like IFCN Talks, Global Fact and International Fact-Checking Day.

Meet the IFCN team:
- Angie Drobnic Holan (Director)
- Ferdi Ferhat Özsoy (Deputy Director)
- Alanna Dvorak (International Training Manager)
- Deirdre Gonsalves (International Grants & Standards Manager)
- Enock Nyariki (Community and Impact Manager)
- Arina Lekht (Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist)
- Salvador Rodriguez-Ruiz (Program Officer)

To learn more, consult the International Fact-Checking Network's Bylaws, read their transparency statement or contact them at factchecknet@poynter.org.

vclaim: The International Fact-Checking Network (IFCN) at Poynter, established in 2015, is a global leader in fact-checking that provides resources, training, and support to over 100 fact-checking operations worldwide. IFCN offers grants and fellowships to support new fact-checking initiatives and programs. The organization provides training, produces annual reports, and organizes global events to connect fact-checkers internationally. IFCN is managed by a team of seven professionals led by Director Angie Drobnic Holan.
